item.title: 連邦地裁判事はメディア・マターズを支持し、テキサス州のケン・パクストン州知事を支持、同州知事によるXに関する広告報道の調査を差し止める。
item.description:
Media Matters for America:
A district court judge sides with Media Matters against Texas AG Ken Paxton, blocking Paxton's probe for now into the outlet's reporting on advertising on X  —  Media Matters President and CEO Angelo Carusone issued the following statement after Judge Amit Mehta of the United States District Court …

item.title: SAG-AFTRA、WMGやソニー・ミュージックエンタテインメントなど大手レコード会社と暫定合意、AI使用に関する保護も盛り込む（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
SAG-AFTRA reaches a tentative deal with major record labels, including WMG and Sony Music Entertainment, that includes protections over the use of AI  —  Hollywood performers and media professionals have reached a tentative deal with major record labels such as Warner Music Group (WMG.O) …

item.title: Audacyは、AIを使って合成音声を作成・編集するElevenLabsと提携し、リスナーや広告クライアント向けの音声ライブラリを構築すると発表した（Paul McLane/Radio World）。
item.description:
Paul McLane / Radio World:
Audacy announces it is partnering with ElevenLabs, which uses AI to create and edit synthetic voices, to build a library of voices for listeners and ad clients  —  It announced a partnership with AI company ElevenLabs  —  One of the largest radio groups in the U.S. is escalating its use of synthetic voices.

item.title: 米上院選に関する党派的な記事を作成するよう指示された、AIを搭載したローカル「ニュース」サイトの作成事例。Fiverrの開発者が80ドルで作成した（Jack Brewster/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Jack Brewster / Wall Street Journal:
A case study of the creation of an AI-powered local “news” website, directed to produce partisan stories on a US Senate race; a Fiverr developer made it for $80  —  I paid a website developer to create a fully automated, AI-generated ‘pink-slime’ news site, programmed to create false political stories.

item.title: メモNPRのキャサリン・マハーは、NPRがその使命を果たしているかどうかを問うのは公正だが、アイデンティティに基づいてスタッフの誠実さを問うのは無礼だと言う（Katherine Maher/NPR）
item.description:
Katherine Maher / NPR:
Memo: NPR's Katherine Maher says questioning whether NPR is living up to its mission is fair, but questioning staff integrity based on identity is disrespectful  —  The message below was sent by NPR's President and CEO to all staff:  —  Dear all,  —  This has been a long week.

item.title: 金曜日、ガザ中心部でのイスラエル軍の攻撃で、トルコの放送局TRTに勤務するサミ・シェハダ氏が足を失うなど、複数のジャーナリストが負傷した（CNN）。
item.description:
CNN:
Several journalists were injured Friday in an Israeli attack in central Gaza, including Sami Shehada, who lost a leg; he works for Turkish broadcaster TRT  —  Israeli forces surrounded and attacked the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza on Friday, wounding several journalists and at least one other person.

item.title: iHeartMediaがテッド・クルーズ上院議員の再選を目的としたPACに送った63万ドルをめぐり、2つのグループがFECに選挙資金に関する苦情を申し立てた（Matthew Choi/The Texas Tribune）。
item.description:
Matthew Choi / The Texas Tribune:
Two groups have filed a campaign finance complaint with the FEC over $630K that iHeartMedia sent to a PAC dedicated to the reelection of US Sen. Ted Cruz  —  End Citizens United and the Campaign Legal Center asserted Cruz could have broken campaign finance rules.

item.title: 実際のポッドキャストに掲載される通常の広告スポットよりも安価な、ポッドキャスト録音のように見えるクリップにブランドがお金を払う、偽のポッドキャスト動画広告を見てみよう（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
A look at faux podcast video ads, where brands pay for clips that look like podcast recordings and that are cheaper than a regular ad spot on an actual podcast  —  Brands like the validating veneer of the podcast look without having to pay premium prices for actual spots on shows  —  Welcome back to Soundbite.

item.title: PBSで20年以上夕方のニュース番組のキャスターを務め、ジム・レーラーとともに公平で派手さのないニュースを伝えたロバート・マクニールが93歳で死去（Elizabeth Jensen/New York Times）
item.description:
Elizabeth Jensen / New York Times:
Robert MacNeil, who anchored evening newscasts for over two decades on PBS and delivered evenhanded, non-flashy news with Jim Lehrer, dies at 93  —  With his longtime co-host Jim Lehrer, he delivered thoughtful reports that stood in stark contrast to the commercial networks' ever more sensational newscasts.

item.title: アドビは、Midjourneyのようなツールで作成され、ユーザーによってストックマーケットプレイスにアップロードされた画像をFireflyの学習に使用。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Adobe used images created by tools like Midjourney and uploaded to its stock marketplace by users to train Firefly; Adobe says ~5% of images were AI-generated  —  Company promotes its tool as safe from content scraped from the internet.  —  When Adobe Inc. released its Firefly image-generating software …

item.title: Netflixがジャーナリスト、ダン・ラザーのドキュメンタリー「Rather」の放映権を獲得。
item.description:
Michael Schneider / Variety:
Netflix acquires the rights to “Rather”, a documentary about journalist Dan Rather, which will premiere April 24  —  Netflix has acquired “Rather,” the documentary about veteran journalist Dan Rather's landmark career in news.  The film, which premieres April 24 on the streamer …

item.title: Rokuによると、ハッカーは3月に同様の侵害を受け、～15Kアカウントに影響を与えた後、クレデンシャル・スタッフィングを使用して～576Kアカウントにアクセスし、～400ケースで購入したという。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Roku says hackers accessed ~576K accounts using credential stuffing, and made purchases in ~400 cases, after a similar breach affecting ~15K accounts in March  —  The new security incident was discovered a month after the company learned that 15,000 accounts were impacted in a similar breach.

item.title: グーグル、カリフォルニア州ジャーナリズム保護法の影響測定のためCAニュースサイトへのリンク削除をテスト、CAニュースエコシステムへの投資を一時停止（Jaffer Zaidi/The Keyword）
item.description:
Jaffer Zaidi / The Keyword:
Google tests removing links to CA news sites to measure the impact of the California Journalism Preservation Act and pauses investments in the CA news ecosystem  —  A pending bill in the California state legislature, the California Journalism Preservation Act (CJPA), would create a “link tax” …

item.title: 11月にレイオフが決定したナスト社のスタッフは、労働組合の契約交渉の結果を待つため、「中央編集グループ」に配属される（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
Condé Nast staff marked for layoffs in November are assigned to a “central editorial group” as they await the outcome of their union's contract negotiations  —  While their union negotiates with top execs about the scale and terms of layoffs, employees who had been working at GQ …

item.title: 先週、LinkedInは、インフルエンサーマーケティング市場に参入するため、Thought Leader広告を通じて、一部のユーザーからの投稿を増幅させるために広告主が支払うことを許可し始めた（Jordan Novet/CNBC）
item.description:
Jordan Novet / CNBC:
Last week, LinkedIn began letting advertisers pay to amplify posts from some users through Thought Leader ads, as it enters the market of influencer marketing  —  Ryan Roslansky, CEO of Microsoft's LinkedIn subsidiary, speaks at a LinkedIn event in San Francisco on Sept. 22, 2016.
